title: Suspiria [Widescreen]
creator_credit: La Seda, Claudio Argento and Dario Argento
brief_description: Presented in widescreen, this un-cut version of Dario Argento’s ‘Suspiria’ is the first part (1980’s ‘Inferno’ being the follow up) in an as yet to be complete trilogy called “The Three mothers”. Susy Banyon (Jessica Harper), an American Ballet student travels to Germany to attend the exclusive Tanz Academy in Frieburg. Legend goes that the ancient school was once the residence of a witches coven, headed by an evil and powerful black witch named Mater Suspiriorum (Black Widow). When a series of grisly murders begin to occur at the ballet school, Susy begins to suspect that witchcraft may be involved. Working at the height of his creative powers (following the box office success of 1975’s ‘Deep Red’) Argento raises the level of terror with his trademark blood soaked set pieces by using vibrant colour film stock, abrupt editing, multi-layered sound scapes (including the techno-rock Goblin score) and rapid camera movement. Cast also includes Alida Valli, Udo Kier, Stefania Casini, Joan Bennett, Flavio Bucci, Miguel Bose, Barbara Magnolfi and Susanna Javicoli.
